entries.title: Fresh appeal for Lyla Lake, 13, missing over Christmas
entries.description: Police issue a new CCTV image of Lyla Lake, who was last seen at Reading train station a week ago.

entries.title: Manchester United 3-0 Nottingham Forest: Erik Ten Hag wants more goals
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik Ten Hag believes his team are capable of increasing the number of goals they score in games, having seen them beat Nottingham Forest 3-0.

entries.title: Burnley 3-0 Birmingham City: Leaders ease further clear by beating Blues
entries.description: Anass Zaroury hits the fastest Championship goal of the season - after just 49 seconds - as leaders Burnley beat Birmingham City.

entries.title: Manchester United 3-0 Nottingham Forest: Marcus Rashford, Anthony Martial & Fred score
entries.description: Marcus Rashford is instrumental as Manchester United continue their renaissance with a comfortable Premier League win over Nottingham Forest.

entries.title: Man, 62, dies after being hit by police car in Livingston
entries.description: An investigation has begun after a pedestrian was struck by a marked police car in Livingston on Boxing Day.

entries.title: Chelsea 2-0 Bournemouth: Hosts claim comfortable win to boost top-four hopes
entries.description: Chelsea boost their top-four hopes as they resume their Premier League season with a comfortable victory over Bournemouth at Stamford Bridge.

entries.title: Four injured in Evesham suspected gas explosion
entries.description: Properties were evacuated and four people taken to hospital after the incident in Evesham.

entries.title: Reading 2-1 Swansea City: Andy Carroll and Tom Ince goals give Royals win
entries.description: Reading move level on points with the Championship play-off places as their third victory from four extends Swansea's winless run to eight games.

entries.title: Premiership: Harlequins 12-15 Bristol Bears - Bears hang on for brilliant win over Quins
entries.description: Bristol Bears produce a gutsy defensive performance to beat Harlequins and move off the bottom of the Premiership table.

entries.title: Russia bans oil sales to countries using price cap
entries.description: The oil price cap, agreed by Western countries, aims to reduce Russian revenue for its war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Cody Fisher stabbed to death on Birmingham nightclub dance floor
entries.description: Cody Fisher was fatally injured at The Crane in Birmingham on 26 December.

entries.title: Spain announces €10bn help to fight rising prices
entries.description: PM Pedro Sánchez backs aid for households amid an energy crisis prompted by Russia's war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Harlequins 48-14 Bristol Bears: Shaunagh Brown ends career on high as Quins thrash Bears
entries.description: Shaunagh Brown ends her rugby career on a high as Harlequins thrash Bristol Bears to leapfrog them in the Premier 15s table.

entries.title: PDC World Championship: Josh Rock beats Nathan Aspinall in decider
entries.description: Northern Ireland's Josh Rock wins a deciding set to beat England's Nathan Aspinall in the third round of the PDC World Championship.

entries.title: Train strikes: Disruption to continue into the New Year
entries.description: Strikes this week include staff from customer service, safety and timetabling at three companies.

entries.title: Covid in China: People rush to book travel as borders finally reopen
entries.description: But Chinese tourists will not have unfettered access to all countries - as some impose restrictions.

entries.title: Dean Smith: Norwich City sack head coach after three defeats in four
entries.description: Dean Smith is sacked as Norwich City head coach after a run of just three wins in 13 Championship matches.

entries.title: Welsh language: Call for more teachers in Patagonia
entries.description: Recruitment of Welsh language teachers in the Argentine province has been difficult since Covid.

entries.title: Republican George Santos admits lying on his CV
entries.description: George Santos, who was recently elected, says he misrepresented his education and employment history.

entries.title: Blind BBC reporter Sean Dilley stops thief from stealing his phone
entries.description: Sean Dilley says he acted 'instinctively' after being targeted in central London early on Tuesday.

entries.title: Russian sausage tycoon Pavel Antov dies in Indian hotel fall
entries.description: Meat millionaire Pavel Antov, who recently denied criticising the war in Ukraine, had just turned 65.

entries.title: Melanie C pulls out of Poland NYE gig in solidarity with 'communities I support'
entries.description: The singer says she has been made aware of issues "that do not align with the communities I support".

entries.title: Jamie Oliver: Sugar tax could fund school meals
entries.description: The celebrity chef says more pupils could get free food, if money raised by the soft drinks levy was used.

entries.title: England in Bangladesh: ODI and T20I series confirmed for March 2023
entries.description: Dates for England's rearranged tour of Bangladesh are confirmed, with three one-day internationals and three Twenty20 internationals in March, 2023.

entries.title: Loyle Carner and Jamie Oliver talk cooking and ADHD
entries.description: The musician tells Jamie Oliver, who is guest editing R4's Today, how cooking is a space for his neurodiversity.

entries.title: Man stabbed to death on Birmingham nightclub dance floor
entries.description: West Midlands Police has launched a murder investigation after the incident at The Crane in Digbeth.

entries.title: Scottish Premiership picks: Guide to the midweek top-flight action
entries.description: Who will win the relegation battle at Tannadice, will Zander Clark grab his chance with Hearts and can Steven Hammell end Motherwell's poor run?

entries.title: Christmas off, then straight back to war
entries.description: A Scottish soldier fighting in Ukraine had a few hours' respite before going back to the front line.

entries.title: Taiwan extends mandatory military service to one year
entries.description: The decision comes as tensions between the self-ruled island and China grow.

entries.title: Could a chatbot answer Prime Minister's Questions?
entries.description: A robot has given evidence in Parliament, an MP has used a chatbot to write a speech - what next?

entries.title: Australia v South Africa: David Warner hits double century before retiring with cramp
entries.description: Australia's David Warner hits a double century before retiring with cramp on day two against South Africa.

entries.title: Detectorist finds Roman gold treasure in field
entries.description: A battered little piece of jewellery found in a Norfolk field is much older than first thought.

entries.title: Katie Taylor v Amanda Serrano and Tyson Fury v Anthony Joshua? Boxing fights we want to see in 2023
entries.description: The boxing fights we want to see in 2023 including Tyson Fury v Anthony Joshua and Katie Taylor v Amanda Serrano 2.

entries.title: Michael Gove: Better housing design could curb development opposition
entries.description: Michael Gove says too many planning applications are "indifferent" and don't focus on "heart and soul".

entries.title: South Korea lifts ban on import of adult sex dolls
entries.description: Life-sized sex dolls resembling minors are still prohibited, officials say.

entries.title: US winter storm traps New York State residents in cars
entries.description: New York State's Buffalo area bears the brunt of a storm that has killed 56 people in the US and Canada.

entries.title: Radio 1Xtra: Jamz Supernova 'happy and complete' as she leaves station
entries.description: After 12 years, Jamz Supernova looks back with pride as she hangs up her 1Xtra headphones.

entries.title: Book 2023: Prince Harry's Spare kicks off publishing bonanza
entries.description: Join us as we lift the curtain on some of the most anticipated books coming our way next year.

entries.title: Cost of living: The hidden poverty in England's least deprived area
entries.description: The people struggling to make ends meet in a village deemed England's "least deprived" area.

entries.title: Kosovo: Serbia puts troops on high alert over rising tensions
entries.description: Sabre-rattling grows amid claims an attack is being planned on the territory's ethnic Serb areas.

entries.title: Train strikes: Services expected to start later as latest walkout ends
entries.description: Passengers are being urged to check travel times as rail workers finish their latest walkout.

entries.title: Somalia's opioid overdose: Young, female and addicted
entries.description: Women open up about the problem of opioid abuse in Somalia following the death of a popular TikToker.

entries.title: The truth about 'medbeds' - a miracle cure that doesn't exist
entries.description: Why has a fictional miracle cure taken off online - and who's making money out of it?

entries.title: One careful step at a time through Lebanon’s minefields
entries.description: It’s dangerous and painstaking work, and even a momentary lapse of concentration could prove fatal.

entries.title: Match of the Day analysis: How 'gutsy' Bukayo Saka stood up when Arsenal needed him
entries.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer shows how Bukayo Saka came to the fore against West Ham in the absence of injured striker Gabriel Jesus.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Light of our life' and '£40,000 hit to incomes'
entries.description: Tributes to Elle Edwards, who was shot dead in a pub on Christmas Eve, dominate Tuesday's front papers.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Five ways conflict could go in 2023
entries.description: As the conflict enters its second calendar year, experts predict what could happen on the ground.
